basics.name: Christopher Nguyen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Senior at the University of Hawaii at Manoa majoring in Computer Science with a minor in Business. Space Grant Fellow courtesy of NASA. Previously interned at IBM and Oceanit.

interests.name: Software Development, Program Management, and Education

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

highlights: Building a cloud service infrastructure for scientists to host and query temperature data from the NASA Reconnaissance Orbiter top map potential ice deposits on the Moon
Reduced the runtime of I/O operations by 85% (6300 hours per year of data) using Pandas and Amazon EC2.
Automated the detection, sandbox, and build processes for 3rd party dependency updates in Watson Data Platform services.
Followed the Visitor design pattern to develop RESTful Node.js and Express APIs to handle dependency version checks and documented them with Swagger.
Led a team of 4 through sprint plannings and daily standups as scrum master.
Architected a blockchain solution for ticket sales at the BlueHack hackathon.
Built a 72” video wall system using open-source software, IP routing, and seven Raspberry Pis.
Tested PySide2, an open-source	Python	binding	of	Qt,	on	the	MinGW development	environment for	a	Windows	CV	application.
Conducted high-level network assessments for external clients and state agencies.
Built a 72” video wall system using open-source software, IP routing, and seven Raspberry Pis.
Conducted initial feasibly tests and prototyping which led to a 97% cost reduction ($58,000 in savings).
Reduced electricity costs by 40% by configuring a smart socket system to monitor and control the video wall’s energy consumption.
Refactored a mobile geographic information system (GIS) app to include a parcel data extraction feature using the ArcGIS API.
Developed a cross-platform Customer Relationship Management (CRM) app for iOS and Android using Cordova, Node.js, and Design Thinking to increase consultant and client interaction by 10%.

work.summary: Computer Science and STEM Mentor under Bebi Davis, PhD of the Kaimuki-McKinley-Roosevelt Complex Area
highlights: Collaborated with 28 schools to develop a 21st-century STEM curriculum which sparked a 48% STEM interest among Hawaii high school students.
Mentored students that totaled $15,000+ in agency awards at the Honolulu District, Hawaii State, and Intel International Science and Engineering Fair.
Connected high school students with external mentors at the John A. Burns School of Medicine for research-based internships.
Taught English to Kindergarteners and painted an entire school in Tecpan, Guatemala courtesy of the Hamilton Award Scholarship (2013).
Vice President, Vietnamese Student Organization at UH Manoa (VSOUH), 2016-Present
Member, Hawaii Undergraduate Initiative (HUI), 2015-Present
Member, IEEE Student Branch, 2015-2016
